title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

  • .5 point for LRAS shifts left (or potential GDP falls)

  • .5 point for lower employment or lower labor force.

Argument that unemployment increase causes LRAS decline is not acceptable.
descriptions:
No point earned.

  • .5 point for LRAS shifts left (or potential GDP falls)

  • .5 point for lower employment or lower labor force.

Argument that unemployment increase causes LRAS decline is not acceptable.

Earns 1 of 1 point.

  • .5 point for LRAS shifts left (or potential GDP falls)

  • .5 point for lower employment or lower labor force.

Argument that unemployment increase causes LRAS decline is not acceptable.

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

1 point for a conclusion and consistent explanation – no half points

  • LRAS shifts left (or potential GDP falls)

  • Deficit causes higher interest rates, less investment, and less capital (If K not mentioned, there must be some logical link from I to LRAS)

OR

  • LRAS shifts right (or potential GDP increases)

  • Tax cut causes increased labor supply and greater potential GDP
descriptions:

  • LRAS shifts right (or potential GDP increases)

  • Tax cut causes increased labor supply and greater potential GDP

Earns 1 of 1 point.

  • LRAS shifts left (or potential GDP falls)

  • Tax cut causes increased labor supply and greater potential GDP

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

  • .5 point for LRAS shifts right (or potential GDP increases)

  • .5 point for one of the following:

    • Productivity or efficiency improves

    • Output per unit of input increases

    • Average cost or production cost per unit declines
descriptions:

  • .5 point for one of the following:

    • Output per unit of input increases

    • Average cost or production cost per unit declines

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

  • .5 point for LRAS shifts right (or potential GDP increases)

  • .5 point for one of the following:

    • Increase in human capital or human resources

    • Increase in labor productivity/efficiency
descriptions:

  • .5 point for one of the following:

    • Increase in labor productivity/efficiency

title: Part e.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

  • .5 point for LRAS shifts right (or potential GDP increases)

  • .5 point for increased savings leads to an investment increase and an increase in the capital stock.

[Note: explanation must include increase in capital stock.]
descriptions:
No point earned.

  • .5 point for LRAS shifts right (or potential GDP increases)

  • .5 point for increased savings leads to an investment increase and an increase in the capital stock.

[Note: explanation must include increase in capital stock.]
